rComments: The way he explains things is really clear and simple for the most part. The exam and midterm were more difficult than I anticipated as the questions were strangely worded and a little too specific, but still fair. Don't be like me and actually go to his office hours for help on the assignments cause instructions are not very clear.

Genuine nice guy, adds in fun stories. He has a fairly small tone variation so can come across "boring" if you're not listening. lectures well done and easy to follow. My class got destroyed by the exam though, much harder than expected (Multiple choice) so just have notes ready + textbook handy
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Graded by few things', 'Tough grader']

rComments: Show up/watch recordings later + take simple notes  A Open book tests so if you can CTRL-F on your notes / textbook well, you'll get a good grade. He seems like a good person as well, with cool stories to connect course concepts. 2 small quiz + midterm + exam (all multi-choice or T/F, relatively easy w good notes) and one paper

Prof Goldmann and the TA are very caring when they know you want to learn and do good in the class. It really is up to you and your participation. I would advise to not leave any work for the last min as stats is something you gradually understand and need the previous reading for the next. I finished with an A- even though I failed the 1st assign.

Prof. Goldmann is great! The course is challenging, but he wants students to succeed. Use his office hours because the assignments aren't the clearest. Once I got feedback I realized I could have easily fixed my mistakes if I'd asked him to look at my plan first. I wish he did extra labs like Riva, but other than that he's my favourite stats prof!

Professor Golmann is great! He is a bit chatty and the classes always have a couple of personal anecdotes or stories, but he's a super nice prof and loves when students engage. The course isn't too hard, the midterm and assignments are open book, the essay is pretty standard but mildly quantitative (descriptive only), but he's always happy to help.

One of the better professors I've had at this school. The content itself is difficult but he tries his best to make sure everyone understands. This is the guy you want teaching your stats classes as he genuinely cares about your success.
teacherRatingTags: ['Accessible outside class', 'Beware of pop quizzes', 'Gives good feedback']

rComments: The most underrated stats professor this university has. The guy is 74 and teaches better than almost any prof I've ever had. Took both 4th year undergrad and Master's level courses, he taught me everything I know about data sciences and it's useful knowledge.

Not an easy course but professor Goldmann and TAs will help you along the way. If you want to succeed in this course follow this advice: sit in or near the front, pay attention, ask lots of questions, participate in the exercises, don't skip class and don't be afraid to go see professor Goldmann. He cares about your success and enjoys the company.

Professor Goldmann is one of those professors that are often misunderstood. He is a great person and is good at what he does. Despite what many think, he actually does care about his students success. Stats is not an easy subject but he can help you. He is always available during office hours to chat. Just make the effort to go and see him.

Taking Professor Goldmann's class on Demography was required, but it didn't make me love it any less. The topic was interesting, and although the material could get dry, Professor Goldmann tried to keep the class lively with some jokes. The final paper was graded fairly, and the midterm and final were open book.

Open book multiple choice midterms, final and pop quizzes, which sounds great until you realize your notes don't cover half the questions because you didn't even touch on it in class. The dryest lectures ever, in a medium sized 2nd year elective class, only about 20 people ever showed up. Tends to come off rude in person and over email.

i actually learned a lot in Goldmann's class, but he is definitely a tough & unforgiving grader, so make sure your projects are completed meticulously. he seems kind of intimidating, but is actually pretty helpfulknowledgeable if you can muster up the courage to ask him a question.

The most heartless professor. He is honestly the worst person to ever teach. Don't know why anyone would allow him to teach in the first place. Doesn't care for students. You won't learn anything in this class.. AVOID THIS PROFESSOR LIKE THE PLAGUE!!!

Not a good professor! He expects the students to be experts and proficient from the third year course. In other words you have to be a stats expert. He does not teach you, you teach yourself.  He cares more about getting through the lecture than making sure the students understand. Try to take this course with someone else if possible.

WORST PROF EVER! He does not care if the students do not understand the material he is teaching.  He's so boring and jokes are lame. You have to learn everything by yourself. He thinks that if you struggle that's how you will learn. Also has bad temper!

Très bon prof, amical et enthousiaste. Les travaux sont demandant mais si on va au cours et on prend de bonnes notes, ce n'est pas trop difficile. L'examen final est composé de choix de réponses et de Vrai ou Faux. Je vous recommande ce prof mais soyez attentif en classe!

Class consisted of 2 somewhat difficult assignments, and a reasonable final.  Unlike some other people, I found the assignments clear and actually thought some web questions were odd.  How many times do people need to ask the due date when it's plainly written on the sheet?  Prof has good sense of humour, and actually attending class helps.

He doesn't give proper direction. He expects you to know what you're doing and know it well.. He is useless for help.. and wont give u help.. And the TA was useless too. If you have to take the class.. DON'T TAKE IT WITH HIM!!!!
Two assignments and a final (multiple choice and T/F). Instructions on the assignments were really poor, and WebCT was overloaded with questions. Very unclear on expectations.
Great slides available on the course site and the TAs were helpful.  The assignments were good, got you actively involved in the material being taught, helped with the overall understanding

Hes fine, can be dry at times, the assignments arent too difficult. One plus is that he works in dEmography, so he really knows this material inside and out, hes very friendly and approachable. He appreciates students who attend regularly, i can see it in his face

A really easy class, but it requires quite a bit of work. The 3 assignments are really straightforward; just make sure you include "implications." His lecturing is painfully boring, but it really drives home the concepts if you can manage to stay awake. It's an interesting course though.
DO NOT TAKE THIS CLASS!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I thought that this class was very interesting....Since we are in Canada, we learnt about Canadian statistics, which make sense to me! I thought that it was a great course, and that he did a great job teaching it!

Not very interesting. He mostly concentrated on Canadian statistics and issues when international issues would better explain demographic theories. Notes are straight from the book aswell. Assignmets are easy, just hand them on time to get full points. But major dissapointment when he only concentrated on Canada rather than international examples.

Yawn. Moves through the material slower than molasses. Slides come mostly straight out of the textbook and he just reads them to the class. Knowledge of concepts is very spotty. Assignments and exams are simple though, and he's kind of charming in a way.
